messageBody:
"Rogers, Jason" wrote:
>
> Why? What possible good does it do you to have the tests if you don't
> have the source to modify? Just curious?

Unit tests document API usage very well, for starters. And they suggest
where any bugs encountered might be, even by their absence (a
problematic condition may not be tested, and a set of tests could rule
out a bunch of possible causes for a bug).

Heck, i'd be happy if vendors would ship a set of tests to run on their
software in an actual customer environment, just to catch known problems
(such as conflicts and naming issues). Open source projects should
include unit tests, of course. :}
